message:
I'm currently using the the following for my Rails 3 app:

EC2
RVM
apache
Passenger

However, I've read a lot about nginx and Thin. Anyone have experience with those that they can share? Are they worth moving to? Any issues integrating with RVM?
but in production, you probably want configuration
I think you're better off sticking with passenger than switching to Thin
I think it actually uses nginx, it just doesn't require any configuration
I've heard good things about the standalone version of Passenger that doesn't require a webserver in front of it.
If you're having concurrent load issues or just like nicer config syntax (IMO) you might like switching out apache for nginx
At scale, absolutely. I have no idea how big the project is.
I'm using Passenger + nginx. AFAIK Unicorn is a way faster and uses a few resources. Also check rainbows!: http://rainbows.rubyforge.org/
Just use Heroku, and let them worry about this while you focus on building a great app :)

Cool, sounds like I should switch to nginx, but thin may not necessarily be a win over passenger.

@ejdraper Would love to just use Heroku, but it ain't cheap!
Anyone have experience with Unicorn or rainbows?
unicorn is good for long running process, i think  ngnix + passenger should be minimal setup for production..
We have an API app taking 3.6m hits a day running nginx/unicorn/god
